{{About|the World War II Partisan formation|the Army of the Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina formation|I Corps (Bosnia and Herzegovina)}} {{infobox military unit |unit_name= Partisan 3rd Corps |image=[[File:Flag of SFR Yugoslavia.svg|220px]] |caption=Flag of Democratic Federal Yugoslavia (used by the Partisans) |dates= 1942–1945 |country= [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|Democratic Federal Yugoslavia]] |allegiance= |branch= [[Yugoslav Partisan]] Army |type= [[Infantry]] |role= |size= [[Corps]] |command_structure= [[Partisan 2nd Army]] |garrison= |garrison_label= |nickname= |patron= |motto= |colors= |colors_label= |march= |mascot= |equipment= |equipment_label= |battles=[[World War II in Yugoslavia]]
* [[13th Waffen Mountain Division of the SS Handschar (1st Croatian)#Anti-Partisan operations March to May 1944|Operation ''Wegweiser'']]
* [[13th Waffen Mountain Division of the SS Handschar (1st Croatian)#Anti-Partisan operations March to May 1944|Operation ''Save'']]
* [[13th Waffen Mountain Division of the SS Handschar (1st Croatian)#Anti-Partisan operations March to May 1944|Operation ''Osterei'']]
* [[13th Waffen Mountain Division of the SS Handschar (1st Croatian)#Anti-Partisan operations March to May 1944|Operation ''Maibaum'']]
* [[13th Waffen Mountain Division of the SS Handschar (1st Croatian)#Anti-Partisan operations March to May 1944|Operation ''Maiglöckchen'']]
* [[13th Waffen Mountain Division of the SS Handschar (1st Croatian)#Anti-Partisan operations June to August 1944|Operation ''Vollmond'']]
* [[13th Waffen Mountain Division of the SS Handschar (1st Croatian)#Anti-Partisan operations June to August 1944|Operation ''Fliegenfänger'']]
* [[13th Waffen Mountain Division of the SS Handschar (1st Croatian)#Anti-Partisan operations June to August 1944|Operation ''Heiderose'']]
* [[13th Waffen Mountain Division of the SS Handschar (1st Croatian)#Anti-Partisan operations June to August 1944|Operation ''Hackfleisch'']] |anniversaries= |decorations= |battle_honours= |battle_honours_label= |disbanded= |notable_commanders=[[Kosta Nađ]]
[[Vladimir Popović (diplomat)|Vladimir Popović]] }} {{command structure |name=1st Bosnian Corps |date=November 1942 |parent=Supreme Headquarters |subordinate=[[4th Krajina Division]]
[[5th Krajina Division]]
[[6th East Bosnian Brigade]] }} {{command structure |name=Partisan 3rd Corps |date=January 1945 |parent=[[Partisan 2nd Army]] |subordinate=[[27th East Bosnia Division]]
[[38th Bosnia Division]] }} The '''3rd Corps''' ({{lang-sh-Latn|treći korpus}}) was a [[Yugoslav Partisan]] [[corps]] that fought against the [[Nazi Germany|Germans]], [[Independent State of Croatia]] (NDH) and [[Chetniks]] in occupied [[Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia|Democratic Federal Yugoslavia]] during [[World War II]]. It was created in November 1942 as the '''1st Bosnian Corps''', and underwent a name change in 1943. It grew in size until 1 January 1945 when it was subordinated to the Partisan 2nd Army. The 3rd Corps spent most of 1944 engaged in hard fighting against the [[13th Waffen Mountain Division of the SS Handschar (1st Croatian)]] in eastern [[Bosnia (region)|Bosnia]]. ==Notes== {{reflist|2}} ==References== * {{cite book |first=George |last=Lepre |title=Himmler's Bosnian Division: The Waffen-SS Handschar Division 1943–1945 |publisher=Schiffer Publishing |location=Atglen, Philadelphia |year=1997 |isbn=0-7643-0134-9 |url= |ref=harv }} * {{cite book |first=Velimir |last=Vuksic |title=Tito's Partisans 1941-45 |publisher=Osprey Publishing |location=Oxford |year=2003 |isbn=1-841766-75-5 |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=SLix5hc4WRgC&printsec=frontcover&source=gbs_ge_summary_r&cad=0#v=onepage&q&f=false |ref=harv }} {{Campaignbox Yugofront}} {{DEFAULTSORT:3rd Corps}} [[Category:Corps of the Yugoslav Partisans]] [[Category:Military units and formations established in 1942]]
